articles.headline: Trump Calls Off Plan to Impose Tariffs on Mexico
articles.snippet: President Trump said Friday evening on Twitter that the “Tariffs scheduled to be implemented by the U.S. on Monday, against Mexico, are hereby indefinitely suspended.”
articles.abstract: President Trump said Friday evening on Twitter that the “Tariffs scheduled to be implemented by the U.S. on Monday, against Mexico, are hereby indefinitely suspended.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump backed off his plan to impose tariffs on all Mexican goods and announced via Twitter on Friday night that the United States had reached an agreement with Mexico to reduce the flow of migrants to the southwestern border.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear, Ana Swanson and Azam Ahmed

articles.headline: Death on the Rio Grande: A Look at a Perilous Migrant Route
articles.snippet: President Trump’s immigration clampdown has pushed an increasing surge of migrants into the harsh river current as the fastest route to American soil.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s immigration clampdown has pushed an increasing surge of migrants into the harsh river current as the fastest route to American soil.
articles.lead_paragraph: EAGLE PASS, Tex. — The 19-year-old pregnant migrant waded toward the American shore, deep enough in the Rio Grande for waves to splash against her waist. Pushing through the river’s current, and mindful of an alligator lingering upriver, she guided her friend’s crying 10-year-old boy toward a Border Patrol rescue boat.

articles.headline: Mexico Agreed to Take Border Actions Months Before Trump Announced Tariff Deal
articles.snippet: President Trump announced an agreement just before punishing tariffs went into effect, but it was unclear whether he saw it as truly new concessions or a face-saving way to defuse his tariff threat.
articles.abstract: President Trump announced an agreement just before punishing tariffs went into effect, but it was unclear whether he saw it as truly new concessions or a face-saving way to defuse his tariff threat.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The deal to avert tariffs that President Trump announced with great fanfare on Friday night consists largely of actions that Mexico had already promised to take in prior discussions with the United States over the past several months, according to officials from both countries who are familiar with the negotiations.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Hong Kong March: Vast Protest of Extradition Bill Shows Fear of Eroding Freedoms
articles.snippet: The demonstration was one of the largest in the territory’s history and showed deep worries about ever-tightening Chinese rule.
articles.abstract: The demonstration was one of the largest in the territory’s history and showed deep worries about ever-tightening Chinese rule.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Hundreds of thousands of people filled the sweltering streets of Hong Kong on Sunday in an immense protest against a government plan to allow extraditions to mainland China that culminated after midnight in clashes with the police.

articles.headline: A Drama of Trump’s Own Making Ends With a Familiar Hero
articles.snippet: The threat to impose tariffs on Mexico was a case study in President Trump’s approach to some of the most daunting issues confronting him and the nation.
articles.abstract: The threat to impose tariffs on Mexico was a case study in President Trump’s approach to some of the most daunting issues confronting him and the nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For nine days, he had his finger on the trigger and threatened to pull. For nine days, he put two countries, entire multinational industries, vast swaths of consumers and workers and even his own advisers and Republican allies on edge, unsure what would happen with billions of dollars at stake.

articles.headline: People Are Trying to Figure Out William Barr. He’s Busy Stockpiling Power.
articles.snippet: Is he the operator who spun the then-secret Mueller report? Or the straight shooter who later disclosed portions that were damaging to President Trump?
articles.abstract: Is he the operator who spun the then-secret Mueller report? Or the straight shooter who later disclosed portions that were damaging to President Trump?
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Not long before Attorney General William P. Barr released the special counsel’s report on Russian interference in the 2016 election, he strategized with Senator Lindsey Graham, the Republican chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee, about one of his next moves: investigating the investigators.
articles.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere, Charlie Savage and Katie Benner

articles.headline: A Billboard No. 1 Is at Stake, So Here’s an Album With Your Taylor Swift Hoodie
articles.snippet: About half the 39 titles that topped the charts last year were sold as part of ticket or merchandise “bundles.” Now even some who benefited from the strategy are complaining.
articles.abstract: About half the 39 titles that topped the charts last year were sold as part of ticket or merchandise “bundles.” Now even some who benefited from the strategy are complaining.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, the phrase “No. 1 with a bullet” has referred to a song or album that zooms to the top of the Billboard charts. Given current music industry practices, “No. 1 with a T-shirt” may be more accurate.

articles.headline: How Old Should a President Be? With So Many Choices, Democrats Are Sharply Divided
articles.snippet: The 2020 Democratic field has one of the youngest presidential candidates in modern history and the oldest one.
articles.abstract: The 2020 Democratic field has one of the youngest presidential candidates in modern history and the oldest one.
articles.lead_paragraph: The 2020 Democratic field has one of the youngest presidential candidates in modern history and the oldest one.
articles.byline: By Lisa Lerer and Denise Lu

articles.headline: United Technologies and Raytheon to Combine Into Aerospace and Military Giant
articles.snippet: United Technologies, with businesses spanning elevators, air-conditioning and aircraft parts, is transforming into a more focused rival to giants like Boeing and Lockheed Martin.
articles.abstract: United Technologies, with businesses spanning elevators, air-conditioning and aircraft parts, is transforming into a more focused rival to giants like Boeing and Lockheed Martin.
articles.lead_paragraph: United Technologies said on Sunday that it planned to combine its aerospace business with Raytheon, uniting the two into a new manufacturing giant in the worlds of aerospace and military weapons and aircraft.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Sudan Protesters, Devastated but Defiant, Regroup Underground After Crackdown
articles.snippet: “This is not the end of the revolution,” said a doctor who was in hiding, his head swathed in bandages. “It’s just the beginning.”
articles.abstract: “This is not the end of the revolution,” said a doctor who was in hiding, his head swathed in bandages. “It’s just the beginning.”
articles.lead_paragraph: KHARTOUM, Sudan — The young doctor had been on the run for days, hiding in a quiet corner of the fear-filled Sudanese capital, Khartoum, his wounded head swaddled in bandages.

articles.headline: Wall Street Asks When, Not if, the Fed Will Cut Interest Rates
articles.snippet: After a weak jobs report and amid continued trade tensions, many Federal Reserve watchers are looking for rate cuts this summer or fall.
articles.abstract: After a weak jobs report and amid continued trade tensions, many Federal Reserve watchers are looking for rate cuts this summer or fall.
articles.lead_paragraph: The American economy is showing signs of cooling, and Wall Street is counting on Jerome H. Powell, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, to come to the rescue.

articles.headline: Trump Lawyer’s Message Was a Clue for Mueller, Who Set It Aside
articles.snippet: The special counsel’s prosecutors cited attorney-client privilege, but legal experts were divided on whether they should have pushed to learn more.
articles.abstract: The special counsel’s prosecutors cited attorney-client privilege, but legal experts were divided on whether they should have pushed to learn more.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the special counsel’s investigators pursued the question of whether President Trump tried to impede their work, they uncovered compelling evidence — a voice mail recording and statements from a trusted witness — that might have led to him.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Charlie Savage

articles.headline: Tesla, Facing Setbacks and Skeptics, Tries to Get Back on Course
articles.snippet: Elon Musk’s electric-car company began the year with high expectations. But it has confronted a series of problems and a loss of investor confidence.
articles.abstract: Elon Musk’s electric-car company began the year with high expectations. But it has confronted a series of problems and a loss of investor confidence.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tesla’s Model 3 electric sedan was heralded this year by Consumer Reports as the most satisfying car on the market. Then owners started to complain that cars had arrived with cracked windows, leaks or unreliable video screens. In some places, Tesla turned to outside body shops to repair scratches and other paint defects before cars were delivered to customers.

articles.headline: Her Evangelical Megachurch Was Her World. Then Her Daughter Said She Was Molested by a Minister.
articles.snippet: Evangelical churches have long distanced themselves from the sexual abuse crisis that has consumed the Catholic Church. But a reckoning has arrived.
articles.abstract: Evangelical churches have long distanced themselves from the sexual abuse crisis that has consumed the Catholic Church. But a reckoning has arrived.
articles.lead_paragraph: HURST, Tex. — Christi Bragg listened in disbelief. It was a Sunday in February, and her popular evangelical pastor, Matt Chandler, was preaching on the evil of leaders who sexually abuse those they are called to protect. But at the Village Church, he assured his listeners, victims of assault would be heard, and healed: “We see you.”

articles.headline: Nissan and Renault Lock Horns as Relationship Sours Further
articles.snippet: The Japanese carmaker criticized its French partner’s vow to block its overhaul effort, further straining the troubled auto alliance.
articles.abstract: The Japanese carmaker criticized its French partner’s vow to block its overhaul effort, further straining the troubled auto alliance.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The cracks in the world’s largest auto alliance grew wider on Monday, as Nissan Motor condemned as “most regrettable” a decision by its French partner, Renault, to withdraw support for the Japanese automaker’s efforts to overhaul its governance.
articles.byline: By Ben Dooley and Jack Ewing

articles.headline: Anger at Big Tech Unites Noodle Pullers and Code Writers
articles.snippet: A wide range of companies are lining up to complain about Silicon Valley’s power as lawmakers and regulators step up their scrutiny of Big Tech.
articles.abstract: A wide range of companies are lining up to complain about Silicon Valley’s power as lawmakers and regulators step up their scrutiny of Big Tech.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Oracle and the Handpulled Noodle would seem to have little in common. One is a multibillion-dollar software company in Silicon Valley with tens of thousands of employees all over the world. The other is a small Harlem spot that serves Chinese comfort food and is known for its tasty dumplings.
articles.byline: By Jack Nicas and Karen Weise
